wikipedia_page.main: William Knight was an English professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Southampton in the years prior to World War I.

response: * William Knight (died 1622), Member of Parliament (MP) for Hythe
* William Knight (Wisconsin politician) (1843–1941), Wisconsin legislator and orchardman
* William Knight (fighter) (born 1988), American mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter
* William Knight (footballer), English football goalkeeper for Southampton (1911–1913)
* William Knight (bishop) (1475–1547), member of the court of Henry VIII, and Bishop of Bath and Wells
He regained his place in goal for the start of the following season, before William Knight replaced him in November 1911, making only four further first-team appearances.
